Items.Title:
Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an investigation into the billing practices of the New York City Fire Department, in relation to its inability to collect money owed to the City for patient transportation provided by the City's Emergency Medical Services.
Items.MatterName: Investigation into the billing practices of the NYFD

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4914-A and by Committee on Rules, A.8563-A, "AN ACT to amend the penal law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving the firearm license fee for certain retired officers, sheriffs, undersheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Waiving the firearm license fee for certain retired officers (S.4914-A,  A.8563-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Marchi and Velella, S.6276, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.9818, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the public officers law, in relation to the code of ethics of public officers".
Items.MatterName: Code of ethics of public officers (S.6276, A.9818)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Sanders, A.9909, "AN ACT to amend chapter 611 of the laws of 1977 relating to allowing certain persons in public employment to file a request for retroactive membership with the state comptroller, and to amend chapter 510 of the laws of 1974 relating to public employee retirement rights and benefits, in relation to providing similar allowances for pedagogical employees of the city of New York similarly situated".
Items.MatterName: Allowing certain persons in public employment to file a request for retroactive membership (A.9909)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Clark, A.2849, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing administrative sanctions on registered architects, licensed professional engineers and other persons for misconduct with respect to applications and other accompanying documents submitted to the department of buildings of the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Imposing administrative sanctions on registered architects (A.2849)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2098, and Assembly Member Lentol, A.3472, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the general municipal law, in relation to pensions paid to certain uniformed employees of the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Pensions paid to certain uniformed employees (S.2098, A.3472)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.2488, and Assembly Members Clark, Brennan, Greene, Colton, et al, A.3718, "AN ACT to amend the general city law, in relation to vacant lots in certain cities".
Items.MatterName: Vacant lots in certain cities (S.2488, A.3718)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation to amend the Real Property Tax Law, in relation to indexing to inflation the maximum income allowed for persons occupying rental units to be eligible for the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.MatterName: Tax Abatement, Real Property SCRIE

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the House of Representatives of the United States of America to adopt the Assure Access to Mammography Act of 2001, which would provide enhanced reimbursement for, and expanded capacity to, mammography services under the Medicare program and for other purposes.
Items.MatterName: Assure Access to Mammography Act of 2001

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the standards of conduct of employment agencies and employers of domestic or household employees placed by employment agencies.
Items.MatterName: Standards and Conduct of employment agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of news boxes.
Items.MatterName: Regulation of news boxes.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the rights and dignity of domestic workers.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the rights and dignity of domestic workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to provide employment discrimination protection to participants in the work experience program and other workfare programs.
Items.MatterName: Provide employment discrimination protection,  WEP & Workfare

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to enact H.R. 2493 to repeal the requirements under the United States Housing Act of 1937 for residents of public housing to engage in community service and to complete economic self-sufficiency programs as a condition of continued residency in public housing.
Items.MatterName: Repeal requrirements under US Housing Act of 1937 (HR2493)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Police Department and the New York City Patrolmen's Benevolent Association to eliminate the "48-hour" rule - a rule which protects a police officer from being questioned by investigators for a period of 48 hours after the commission of alleged acts of misconduct.
Items.MatterName: NYPD and NYPBA to eliminate the 48-hour rule.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend New York State Public Officers Law to require that the hiring of police officers to the New York City Police Department be restricted to New York City residents.
Items.MatterName: Hiring of Police Officers be restricted to NYC residents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to create an office of special prosecutor for matters involving police misconduct and brutality.
Items.MatterName: Create Office of Special Prosecutor, Police Misconduct & Brutality

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass one of a number of bills authorizing the revocation of drivers' licenses of persons convicted of making graffiti.
Items.MatterName: Revocation of drivers' licenses if convicted of making graffiti.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Father Michael J. McGivney Way, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Father Michael J. McGivney Way, Brooklyn.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring April 24, 2002 to be "Armenian Martyrs Day" in the City of New York, urging all people to remember the genocide of the Armenian people that was perpetrated by the Ottoman Turks, calling upon the President of the United States to vigorously pursue an acknowledgment of the genocide from modern Turkey and directing the Clerk of the City of New York to forward a copy of this resolution to the President of the United States.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declaring April 24, 2002 to be "Armenian Martyrs Day"

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to education and training for public assistance recipients.
Items.MatterName: Education and Training for public assistance recipients.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the distribution of an annual health plan report card to city employees and retirees.
Items.MatterName: Annual Health Plan Report Card

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor to withdraw, or in the alternative the State Legislature to disapprove, the Governor's recent proposal to change the Tuition Assistance Program (TAP) by deferring one-third of eligible students' grants until they have finished their degrees.
Items.MatterName: Tuition Assistance Program (TAP), Withdraw or Disapprove

Items.Title: Resolution adopting the rule amendments of the Procurement Policy Board to raise the small purchase limits for services, construction and construction-related services.
Items.MatterName: Procurement Policy Board

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill 4227 and its companion Senate Bill 2334 to amend the Real Property Tax Law, in relation to increasing the allowable maximum income of persons occupying rental units otherwise eligible for tax abatement in certain cases.
Items.MatterName: Tax Abatement, Maximum Income (S.1422 A.2254)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the inspection of dwellings to accommodate individuals and families and recipients of section 8 vouchers.
Items.MatterName: Inspection of dwellings for Section 8 recipients.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of non-wood bats by minors.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of non-wood bats by minors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter in relation to the custody and control of city records of historical, research, cultural or other important value.
Items.MatterName: Custody and control of city records

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to childhood lead poisoning prevention, including the avoidance and remediation of lead-based paint hazards in housing and day care facilities, the repeal of local law number 38 for the year 1999 and the repeal of subdivision h of section 27-2013 and section 27-2126 of such code.
Items.MatterName: Lead Poisoning Prevention

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Justice to approve the City's application for a waiver to continue to use funds for officer salaries for Fiscal Years 2003 and 2004 under the Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS) program, and urging both the United States Congress and the Department of Justice to amend program requirements to enable federal funds to continue to assist the New York City Police Department in its crime-fighting efforts.
Items.MatterName: Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Government to take all actions necessary, including amending the existing Federal Emergency Management Agency guidelines, to reimburse the New York City Police Department for all expenses related to the attack on the World Trade Center.
Items.MatterName: FEMA, Reimburse NYPD related to attack on WTC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to prohibit packaging that is not recyclable or biodegradable.
Items.MatterName: Recyclable Biodegradable Packaging

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the regulation of receptacles for removal of waste material.
Items.MatterName: Waste Material Receptacle Regulation

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing the age limit for police officers.
Items.MatterName: Police Officer Age Limit Removal

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the protection of trees.
Items.MatterName: Trees, Protection

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill A607, which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to exclude from the definition of income all medical and prescription drug expenses actually paid by a senior citizen which were not reimbursed or paid for by insurance, for purposes of determining eligibility for the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) benefits.
Items.MatterName: SCRIE, Medical and Drugs Exemption

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact and the Governor to sign into law legislation to merge the New York City Departments of Correction and Probation.
Items.MatterName: Correction/Probation Departments, Merge

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reasonable accommodation in employment of needs of victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.
Items.MatterName: Employment discrimination against victims of domestic violence.

Items.Title: Zoning resolution amendment application no. 010182 ZRM, pursuant to §197-d and §200 of the New York City Charter, concerning changes in the text of the zoning resolution, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4, relating: an amendment to the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York relating to Section 99-052 (a)(3) (recesses, balconies and dormers) in the Special Madison Avenue Preservation District.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Zoning Text Changes, CD#4, Manhattan (20010182ZRM)
